DataElement.preferredName: Prior Therapeutic Procedure Progressive Disease Or Intolerance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to prior treatments, progressive disease, and the inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in a normal way as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Therapeutic Procedure Progressive Disease Or Intolerance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Progressive Disease Or Intolerance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed since patient received medical therapy directed at the PN and if patient received previous GIST-directed therapy has progression (defined by RECIST) been demonstrated or patient is unable to tolerate their previous therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed since patient received medical therapy directed at the PN and if patient received previous GIST-directed therapy has progression (defined by RECIST) been demonstrate or patient is unable to tolerate their previous therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient did not tolerate previous chemotherapy regimens, was there disease progression within 4 months after the last dose of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient experienced disease progression during or within 4 months after the last dose of chemotherapy for metastatic disease, during or within 6 months after the last dose of adjuvant chemotherapy, or has been intolerant of previous chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If enrolled in the Dose Escalation Cohort, has patient had progressive disease on a prior PARP inhibitor, or intolerable toxicity, prior to enrolling on the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received at least 2 prior treatments for prostate cancer (in either hormone sensitive or castration-resistant disease) as follows: past progression or intolerance to at least one secondary hormonal therapy (abiraterone, enzalutamide, galeterone, apalutamide, darolutamide, orteronel, seviteronel or equivalent); past progression or intolerance to taxane-based chemotherapy?
